result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Matthew Glen Mayer was found guilty of OWI (5th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Forfiture of $1,800.00 plus court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments. 
AS TO RESTITUTION/ALL FINANCIAL OBLIGATIONS:   To be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds.  Balance to be paid during term of Extended Supervision.  Nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

**01-21-16/ Judge Mark A Sanders**
The Court ordered that restitution  in the amount of $1,073.08 to UW System - Office of Risk Management, be collected by the DOC from up to 25% of prison funds; balance to be paid during term of ES.  Non-payment penalty shall be civil judgment.
**  **  **  **  **  **  **  **  
$1,073.08 payable to UW System- Office of Risk Management. To be paid first, before court costs, fees and assessments.  Remaining balance of requested restitution to be conducted at hearing December 15, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.

Consecutive to: Consecutive to any other sentence.
Defendant is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program only after serving the first six (6) months of sentence.

superMiscConds.notes:
Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full time, defendant to have a part time job.
Vocational assessment.  Participate in any programs recommended.
Mental health assessment. Cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications in dosages prescribed by treating physician.

No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.
No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing.
No alcohol or controlled substances.

Cooperate with agent.
Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program.
AODA assessment and any recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety.  Random urine screens and breathalyzers.

supervisions.notes: Court Order for IDP Related Offense Driver Assessment and Driver Safety Plan signed and filed.

Provide a DNA sample, pay related surcharge.
Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his rights have been restored.

Defendant Matthew Glen Mayer in court with attorney Ronnie Ismael Vargas.  Defendant Matthew Glen Mayer in custody.  Daniel J. Gabler appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Restitution if ordered in the amount of $1,073.08 payable to UW System - Office of Risk Management, to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.

ADDRESS INFO for Matthew Glen Mayer
Current: W172 N9496 Erika Road, Menomonee Falls, WI 53051 United States  (Effective: 12-09-2015)
Prior: 5709 North Bay Ridge Avenue, Whitefish Bay, WI 53217

Attorney Vargas in court and a new date was obtained for the Restitution Hearing (Br. 28 not in session on the originally scheduled date of December 15, 2015).  Attempts were made to have the defendant appear via video for his hearing.  Video technician unavailable on January 21, 2016.  Email sent to State and Atty. Vargas indicating that the defendant needs to be produced for this date.
Email sent to ADA Arn and Attorney Vargas notifying them that Br. 28 is not available to hear the restitution hearing currently scheduled for December 15, 2015.
Original Transcript (74 pages) PLEA AND SENTENCING HEARING commencing OCTOBER 30, 2015 received and filed.
15A 038833/reversed.  applied in error. Restitution hearing scheduled.
WCS Intoxicated Driver Intervention Program Report received and filed.

Defendant Matthew Glen Mayer in court with attorney Ronnie Ismael Vargas.  Jeremy R. Arn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Pursuant to plea negotiations, and on motion of the State, Court ordered COUNT 2 DISMISSED.   Defendant changes plea to GUILTY on COUNT 1.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged in the information and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  

Sentencing proceeded.  Statements made by State, Defense and Defendant.  

AS TO COUNT 1:

The Court sentenced defendant to serve a term of IMPRISONMENT in the Wisconsin State Prisons for 39 MONTHS.  INITIAL CONFINEMENT of 15 MONTHS and EXTENDED SUPERVISION of 24 MONTHS, consecutive to any other sentence, with credit for 18 days time served.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-Defendant is not eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is eligible for the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program only after serving the first 6 months of sentence.
-Restitution set at $1,073.08 payable to UW System - Office of Risk Management, to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment.  Restitution to be paid before Court costs, fees and assessments.  Remaining balance of requested restitution to be conducted at a restitution hearing.
-Defendant to pay a forfeiture in the amount of $1,800.00 PLUS Court costs and all applicable surcharges and assessments are to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall be a civil judgment
-Defendant is to provide a DNA sample and pay the related surcharge to be collected by DOC from up to 25% of prison funds, balance to be paid during term of extended supervision; nonpayment penalty shall result in a civil judgment
-No new law violations rising to the level of probable cause
-No association with drug users, drug dealers and drug houses or otherwise engage in drug dealing
-Cooperate with agent
-Obtain/maintain employment unless in school.  If in school full-time, defendant to have a part-time job 
-Successfully complete a Cognitive Thinking Behavioral Modification Program
-Vocational assessment; participate in any programs recommended 
-Mental health assessment and  cooperate with any recommended treatment to include any counseling, therapy and taking any prescribed medications in dosages prescribed by treating physician
-AODA assessment and any recommended treatment
-Absolute sobriety with random urine screens and breathalyzers
-No alcohol or controlled substances  
-36 months drivers license revocation
-24 months ignition interlock

Court advised the defendant that as a convicted felon he may no longer use or possess any firearms or body armor; also he may not vote in any election until his civil rights have been restored.

Filed, Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief
Filed, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement
